data.title: Heli heal
data.body:
Fix for #12139 

Notes:
I added an "idleOnPad" parameter to ResupplyAircraft and HeliReturnToBase, kind of shadows the changes previously done with "abortOnResupply". By default it is always false, except in the cases of the commands "Enter" and "Return to Base".

Changelog:
"Enter" and "Return to Base" commands result in helipads idling on the pad to allow mechanics access to perform repairs in the case the building is a "RearmBuilding". Otherwise, @pchote  behavior of takeoff after reload/repair is still maintained. This change basically only affects the RA mod and helo interaction with mechanics.

data.title: Helicopters Can Not Be Commanded to Stay on Pad
data.body:
This is a continuation/improvement upon #12102 that allows mechanics to more easily repair helo units.

Issuing an "Enter" command (mouse command to land) for a hind currently results in a "touch-and-go" behavior if it is fully armed. This is counter-intuitive.

Issuing a "Return to Base" command (F hotkey) results in a group of helos clustering around a single helipad.

I argued in #12102 that these situations should result in the helos landing and idling on the pad. I will submit a pull request with these modifications.

data.title: FixHeader: Add support for "/LargeAddressAware"
data.body:
closes #12125 Thanks to @chrisforbes who explained me the PE Header Layout =)
closes https://github.com/OpenRA/ra2/issues/304

To test:
- use VS `dumpbin.exe` in:

```
`C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio 14.0\VC\bin> .\dumpbin.exe /HEADERS <OpenRA.Game.exe-path>
```

the output should be:

```
FILE HEADER VALUES
             14C machine (x86)
               3 number of sections
        57EEF3CA time date stamp Sat Oct  1 01:22:50 2016
               0 file pointer to symbol table
               0 number of symbols
              E0 size of optional header
             122 characteristics
                   Executable
                   Application can handle large (>2GB) addresses <---- here
                   32 bit word machine
```
- or use PE Explorer (look for the checkbox) next to the red square under characteristics

![pe_explorer](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2057932/19009820/07b5fc04-8778-11e6-98a9-0339a7f3d53e.png)

data.title: Search for the Next free closest Proc
data.body: This enables Harvesters to use the next closest and free Refinery as like in the originals

data.title: [Lint] Report when Maps contains invalid custom rules.
data.body: This prevents the loading of default rules when loading (custom) Rules fails.

data.title: TS polishing pass: More depth sorting and starting units
data.body:
- Fixes depth sorting of editor actors (spawnpoint, waypoint, camera)
- Fixes depth sorting and offsets of several civilian structures
- Increases number of starting units for medium by 1 and for heavy by 2

data.title: TS polishing pass: Overhauled missiles.yaml
data.body:
Reduces size and duplication by using a `^DefaultMissile`.
Overhauls the launch and flight behavior of missiles to be much closer to the original, while tweaking turn rates and `RangeLimit` to (mostly) maintain their ability to hit moving or very close targets.
- much lower launch speed and maximum speed
- much higher launch angle and cruise altitude, doubled VerticalRateOfTurn to make up for it
- increased RangeLimit, especially for AA-only missiles
- fixed Bike warhead Spread to match other missiles
- fixed SAM site missile explosion to match original
- fixed damage warheads of AA-only missile to be valid against ground as well (to avoid not damaging aircraft that just landed after the missile was launched)

data.title: TS polishing pass: Ion Cannon, z-sorting, offsets, explosions
data.body:
- Adds alpha versions of effect palette for 25%, 50% and 75% alpha (these 3 were available in the original as well)
- Fixes remaining bugs (sound not playing, z-sorting) and inconsistencies (the original used alpha transparency, not additive blending, original charge time was 8.5 minutes at 15 fps) of Ion Cannon and clean up redundant sequences
- Changes Tick Tank and Titan cannon explosions to match original (they were each one size too large)
- Fixes Cyborg Commando weapon explosion to match original
- Uses 75% alpha for large explosions
- Fixes depth/Z sorting of smoke trails, projectiles and some other misc stuff
- Fixes Armament LocalOffsets for Bazooka and Bike

data.title: Updated MaxMind.GeoIP to version 2.7.1
data.body:
as requsted by @rapgro in https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1270525#c7

See https://github.com/maxmind/GeoIP2-dotnet/releases and https://github.com/maxmind/MaxMind-DB-Reader-dotnet/releases for a changelog, which seems to indicate this only standardizes and updates build dependencies.

data.title: Investigate compacting the LOH at the start/end of loading
Yaml merge errors are silently dropped by the linter.
data.body: The default rules are loaded instead.  This then causes confusing errors like the ones seen in #12086.  I suspect some of the linter weirdness we've seen on the resource center is caused by this.

data.title: Change Aircraft.IsMoving to be true only when moving horizontally
data.body:
This gets rid of the overly simplistic "above ground = moving" assumption aircraft currently make, removing the need to work around it in other places.

In case we need a vertical movement check later, I added `IsMovingVertically` as a precaution.

Prerequisite for #11886.

data.title: OpenRa has encountered a fatal error while playing Mission 04 - RA: Ten to one

milestone.title: release-20161015
milestone.description: Stability release with burning trees and video installation.

data.body:
Hi,
my OpenRa encountered a fatal error:
[copied from EventLog]
Name der fehlerhaften Anwendung: OpenRA.Game.exe, Version: 0.0.0.0, Zeitstempel: 0x00000000
Name des fehlerhaften Moduls: unknown, Version: 0.0.0.0, Zeitstempel: 0x00000000

Fehleroffset: 0x0c04d158
ID des fehlerhaften Prozesses: 0x3228
Startzeit der fehlerhaften Anwendung: 0x01d21a8d2cce6c1b
Pfad der fehlerhaften Anwendung: C:\Program Files (x86)\OpenRA\OpenRA.Game.exe
Pfad des fehlerhaften Moduls: unknown

An Exeptionlog was not created.

[Logs.zip](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/files/501642/Logs.zip)
Any ideas?

Thanks :)

CK

data.title: Game still too slow, even with suggested modifications
data.body:
Hi,

first of all thanks for this wonderful game :)
As the title says, it's unfortunately too slow.

I'm using Trisquel GNU/Linux,
I have libmono 3.2.8 (I think... I also have 2.0 and 4.0), and managed to spawn a new x server:
xinit /usr/games/openra mono --gc=sgen -- :1 vt$XDG_VTNR

```
   bei OpenRA.Game.Run() in d:\ssss\OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Game.cs:Zeile 752.
   bei OpenRA.Program.Run(String[] args) in d:\ssss\OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Support\Program.cs:Zeile 134.
   bei OpenRA.Program.Main(String[] args) in d:\ssss\OpenRA\OpenRA.Game\Support\Program.cs:Zeile 41.
```

Reproduce case (maybe 3 attempts needed but do not cclose the game):
1. load the mod and open dustbowl in the map editor and load 2 other maps afterwards in the editor (everytime without saving)
2. Goto Mod chooser and reload the mod

data.title: Add zoom scaling support to WithDecoration
data.body:
This allows modders to use it for things like sprite selection boxes, which can be used to improve performance (sprite decorations cost less render performance than system-drawn lines, at least on my system) or use entirely different art style for selection boxes.

Performance test case: https://github.com/reaperrr/OpenRA/tree/sprite-seldeco

In that test case, with ~390 Minigunners selected, ms/Render went down from ~14.5 to ~12.0 on my system when using a sprite selection box instead of the selection box renderable (local debug compile, performance gains in release would likely be lower).

data.title: Rocket soldier's are unable to hit aircraft hovering directly above.
data.body:
If you build 5 rocket soldiers and remove the soldier in the center, then place a helicopter directly above them. The 4 remaining soldiers will be unable to hit the helicopter.

Perhaps this can be fixed by giving the RedEye AA rocket a minimum range of 0c512 -- just like the Dragon (AG) rocket has. This would make the 4 remaining rocket soldiers reposition themselves like the soldier in the center currently does.
[Rocket_Soldier_AA.zip](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/files/498832/Rocket_Soldier_AA.zip)

data.title: Technicians
data.body:
When you sell a building ... you actually dont get a civilian in the original ... but "Technicians"... that use civilian-sprites ... 

![technician](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9139965/18911574/204ac71e-857e-11e6-849a-3e3c0165641d.png)

according to http://cnc.wikia.com/wiki/Technician_%28Red_Alert%29 :

```
... technicians in Red Alert 1 could do mild damage to units with no armour whatsoever, like the V2 Rocket Launcher ...
```

data.title: Engineer walks in oil derrick (RA1)
data.body:
Map:  http://resource.openra.net/maps/16481/
Replay: (note I zipped the replayfile because this uploader does not support the replay format)
[EngineerBug (watch yellows Oil) map Orion.zip](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/files/496510/EngineerBug.watch.yellows.Oil.map.Orion.zip)

The replay shows an engineer (from player yellow) walking in a oil derrick.

The Mod Is RA1 where normally engineers have to get close, but not walk inside buildings.
That map has custum rules, yes, but engineers are using the normal RA1 behaviour on this map. 
I even checked tha yaml file. And there's no Lua script added. 
In my understanding of the custum rules, they can't change between those 2 capture modes while the match is running. 
I think this could be a rare bug.
I tried to recreate the capture behaviour but was unable to do so.

Thanks for checking, greetings yellow

data.title: Crash while trying to press LMB on any menu entry.
data.body:
Hi! Here my crash logs in bzip2 format, I using just freshly installed current  openra-20160904-1.14.noarch package from opensuse OBS repository for my Tumbleweed Linux instance. It seems that it has implemented somehow very cutting edge new packages and despite I have already installed package called "dialog" the logs shows up errors "Could not find collection 'dialog'" while game trying to find it in my system. Also I have few mono-4.4.2 or something version errors in exceptions.log file (I wouldn't tell that the packaging team here work are bad, they doing fine but something goes wrong anyway and I have no clue what to do). Have no out of sync errors. Other issues listen on your main github.com page seems not in my case so I decide to open up a new issue. Anyway I can try to wait on actual release of your game so Its not critical for me since I still need to retrieve original game files somewhere.
[openra.logs.bzip2.zip](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/files/496147/openra.logs.bzip2.zip)
Steps for reproducing the bug:
1. Launch the game,
2. Press LMB on any menu entry then the game crashes on the desktop.

data.title: RA2 lobrdb* sprites are not parsed correctly
data.body: https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/12098 hides the crash, but didn't really solve https://github.com/OpenRA/ra2/issues/292. Looks like https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/bleed/OpenRA.Mods.Common/SpriteLoaders/ShpTSLoader.cs doesn't fully implement the compression used or it doesn't swallow corrupt data like the original game.

data.body:
This PR is basically a PR of #11787, #12047, #12048 in one PR to fix the mirror problems
and enables the Installation and Download of "stripped down" Firestorm Assets and Music.

Most work and thanks goes to @Mailaender

data.title: Add support for applying a target flash to actors through lua
data.body: Allows to code stuff like https://youtu.be/afzfD0AGTPQ?t=5m32s.

data.title: Don't render off-screen selection decorations
data.body:
They are not effects so they're not covered by #11676, but selection decorations are more expensive than actor sprite graphics and many effects, so screen-partitioning them as well would help render performance when the player has any significant force selected outside his current viewport.

In my case, with a bit over 200 actors off-screen, the difference between 'all selected' and 'none selected' was ~9 Render ms/tick (~12.5 vs. ~3.1), so the potential win in these situations is rather huge.
